name: Hydrogen
description: Hydrogen is the lightest and most abundant chemical element in the Universe.

name: Helium
description: Helium is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, non-toxic, inert, monatomic gas.

name: Lithium
description: Lithium is a soft, silvery-white alkali metal.

name: Beryllium
description: Beryllium is a hard, grayish metal naturally found in mineral rocks.

name: Boron
description: Boron is a metalloid essential for plant growth.

name: Carbon
description: Carbon is the basis for organic chemistry, forming a vast number of compounds.

name: Nitrogen
description: Nitrogen makes up 78% of Earth's atmosphere.

name: Oxygen
description: Oxygen is essential for respiration in most living organisms.

name: Fluorine
description: Fluorine is the most reactive and electronegative of all elements.

name: Neon
description: Neon is a noble gas used in neon signs and lighting.

name: Sodium
description: Sodium is a soft, silvery-white, highly reactive metal.

name: Magnesium
description: Magnesium is a shiny gray solid, used in alloys and biological systems.

name: Aluminum
description: Aluminum is a lightweight, silvery-white metal, widely used in industry.

name: Silicon
description: Silicon is a hard, brittle crystalline solid, a key component in electronics.

name: Phosphorus
description: Phosphorus is a reactive nonmetal, essential for life.

name: Sulfur
description: Sulfur is a bright yellow, crystalline solid, used in fertilizers and chemicals.

name: Chlorine
description: Chlorine is a yellow-green gas, used as a disinfectant.

name: Argon
description: Argon is a colorless, odorless noble gas, used in lighting and welding.

name: Potassium
description: Potassium is a soft, silvery metal, essential for living cells.

name: Calcium
description: Calcium is a soft gray metal, vital for bones and teeth.

name: Scandium
description: Scandium is a soft, silvery transition metal.

name: Titanium
description: Titanium is a strong, low-density, highly corrosion-resistant metal.

name: Vanadium
description: Vanadium is a hard, silvery-grey, ductile, and malleable transition metal.

name: Chromium
description: Chromium is a steely-grey, lustrous, hard and brittle metal.

name: Manganese
description: Manganese is a hard, brittle, silvery metal, used in steel alloys.

name: Iron
description: Iron is a metal in the first transition series, essential for blood production.

name: Cobalt
description: Cobalt is a hard, lustrous, silver-gray metal, used in alloys.

name: Nickel
description: Nickel is a silvery-white lustrous metal with a slight golden tinge.

name: Copper
description: Copper is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity.

name: Zinc
description: Zinc is a bluish-silver, lustrous metal, used to galvanize other metals.

name: Gallium
description: Gallium is a soft, silvery metal that melts just above room temperature.

name: Germanium
description: Germanium is a lustrous, hard, grayish-white metalloid.

name: Arsenic
description: Arsenic is a metalloid with various allotropes, used in pesticides and semiconductors.

name: Selenium
description: Selenium is a nonmetal, essential in small amounts for cellular function.

name: Bromine
description: Bromine is a reddish-brown liquid at room temperature, used in flame retardants.

name: Krypton
description: Krypton is a colorless, odorless, tasteless noble gas.

name: Rubidium
description: Rubidium is a soft, silvery-white metallic element.

name: Strontium
description: Strontium is a soft, silver-yellow, alkaline earth metal.

name: Yttrium
description: Yttrium is a silvery-metallic transition metal.

name: Zirconium
description: Zirconium is a lustrous, grey-white, strong transition metal.

name: Niobium
description: Niobium is a soft, grey, ductile transition metal.

name: Molybdenum
description: Molybdenum is a silvery metal with one of the highest melting points.

name: Technetium
description: Technetium is a radioactive, silvery metal, first element produced artificially.

name: Ruthenium
description: Ruthenium is a rare transition metal belonging to the platinum group.

name: Rhodium
description: Rhodium is a rare, silvery-white, hard, and chemically inert transition metal.

name: Palladium
description: Palladium is a rare, precious metal, used in catalytic converters.

name: Silver
description: Silver is a soft, white, lustrous transition metal, highest electrical conductivity.

name: Cadmium
description: Cadmium is a soft, bluish-white metal, chemically similar to zinc and mercury.

name: Indium
description: Indium is a soft, malleable metal, used in electronics.

name: Tin
description: Tin is a soft, silvery-white metal, used as a protective coating for other metals.

name: Antimony
description: Antimony is a lustrous gray metalloid, used in flame-proofing and alloys.

name: Tellurium
description: Tellurium is a brittle, mildly toxic, rare, silver-white metalloid.

name: Iodine
description: Iodine is a dark-gray/purple-black solid, essential for thyroid function.

name: Xenon
description: Xenon is a colorless, dense, odorless noble gas, used in lighting.

name: Cesium
description: Cesium is a soft, gold-colored, highly reactive metal.

name: Barium
description: Barium is a soft, silvery alkaline earth metal.

name: Lanthanum
description: Lanthanum is a soft, ductile, silvery-white metal, first of the lanthanides.

name: Cerium
description: Cerium is a soft, silvery, ductile metal, most abundant of the lanthanides.

name: Praseodymium
description: Praseodymium is a soft, silvery, malleable, and ductile metal.

name: Neodymium
description: Neodymium is a soft, silvery metal, used in powerful magnets.

name: Promethium
description: Promethium is a radioactive metal, only found in trace amounts on Earth.

name: Samarium
description: Samarium is a hard, silvery metal, used in magnets and electronics.

name: Europium
description: Europium is a moderately hard, silvery metal, used in phosphorescent materials.

name: Gadolinium
description: Gadolinium is a silvery-white, malleable, and ductile rare-earth metal.

name: Terbium
description: Terbium is a silvery-white, rare earth metal, used in electronics.

name: Dysprosium
description: Dysprosium is a rare earth element, used in magnets and lasers.

name: Holmium
description: Holmium is a soft, malleable, silvery rare earth metal.

name: Erbium
description: Erbium is a silvery-white solid metal, used in lasers and optical fibers.

name: Thulium
description: Thulium is a soft, malleable, silvery rare earth metal.

name: Ytterbium
description: Ytterbium is a soft, malleable, ductile, and highly reactive rare earth metal.

name: Lutetium
description: Lutetium is a silvery-white metal, the last element in the lanthanide series.

name: Hafnium
description: Hafnium is a lustrous, silvery-gray transition metal, chemically similar to zirconium.

name: Tantalum
description: Tantalum is a rare, hard, blue-gray, lustrous transition metal.

name: Tungsten
description: Tungsten is a hard, rare metal, notable for its highest melting point.

name: Rhenium
description: Rhenium is a silvery-white, heavy, third-row transition metal.

name: Osmium
description: Osmium is a hard, brittle, bluish-white transition metal, densest naturally occurring element.

name: Iridium
description: Iridium is a very hard, brittle, silvery-white transition metal.

name: Platinum
description: Platinum is a dense, malleable, highly unreactive, precious, silverish-white transition metal.

name: Gold
description: Gold is a bright, slightly reddish yellow, dense, soft, malleable, and ductile metal.

name: Mercury
description: Mercury is a heavy, silvery d-block element, only metallic element that is liquid at standard conditions.

name: Thallium
description: Thallium is a soft gray post-transition metal, not found free in nature.

name: Lead
description: Lead is a heavy metal, denser than most common materials, soft and malleable.

name: Bismuth
description: Bismuth is a brittle metal with a silvery white color when freshly produced.

name: Polonium
description: Polonium is a rare and highly radioactive metal with no stable isotopes.

name: Astatine
description: Astatine is a rare, radioactive element, the rarest naturally occurring halogen.

name: Radon
description: Radon is a radioactive, colorless, odorless, tasteless noble gas.

name: Francium
description: Francium is a highly radioactive metal and the second rarest naturally occurring element.

name: Radium
description: Radium is an intensely radioactive metal, discovered by Marie and Pierre Curie.

name: Actinium
description: Actinium is a soft, silvery-white radioactive metal, the first of the actinides.

name: Thorium
description: Thorium is a weakly radioactive, soft, silvery metal.

name: Protactinium
description: Protactinium is a dense, silvery-gray actinide metal, radioactive and rare.

name: Uranium
description: Uranium is a silvery-grey metal, used as fuel in nuclear reactors.

name: Neptunium
description: Neptunium is a radioactive actinide metal, first transuranic element.

name: Plutonium
description: Plutonium is a radioactive, silvery-gray actinide metal, used in nuclear weapons.

name: Americium
description: Americium is a synthetic radioactive element, used in smoke detectors.

name: Curium
description: Curium is a hard, dense, radioactive metal, named after Marie and Pierre Curie.

name: Berkelium
description: Berkelium is a radioactive, silvery metal, named after Berkeley, California.

name: Californium
description: Californium is a radioactive, metallic chemical element, used in neutron sources.

name: Einsteinium
description: Einsteinium is a synthetic, radioactive metal, named after Albert Einstein.

name: Fermium
description: Fermium is a synthetic, radioactive metal, named after Enrico Fermi.

name: Mendelevium
description: Mendelevium is a synthetic, radioactive metal, named after Dmitri Mendeleev.

name: Nobelium
description: Nobelium is a synthetic, radioactive metal, named after Alfred Nobel.

name: Lawrencium
description: Lawrencium is a synthetic, radioactive metal, named after Ernest O. Lawrence.

name: Rutherfordium
description: Rutherfordium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Ernest Rutherford.

name: Dubnium
description: Dubnium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Dubna, Russia.

name: Seaborgium
description: Seaborgium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Glenn T. Seaborg.

name: Bohrium
description: Bohrium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Niels Bohr.

name: Hassium
description: Hassium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after the German state of Hesse.

name: Meitnerium
description: Meitnerium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Lise Meitner.

name: Darmstadtium
description: Darmstadtium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Darmstadt, Germany.

name: Roentgenium
description: Roentgenium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Wilhelm Röntgen.

name: Copernicium
description: Copernicium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Nicolaus Copernicus.

name: Nihonium
description: Nihonium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Japan (Nihon).

name: Flerovium
description: Flerovium is a superheavy artificial element, named after the Flerov Laboratory.

name: Moscovium
description: Moscovium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Moscow Oblast, Russia.

name: Livermorium
description: Livermorium is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory.

name: Tennessine
description: Tennessine is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Tennessee, USA.

name: Oganesson
description: Oganesson is a synthetic, radioactive element, named after Yuri Oganessian.
